content: In the following questions, I will provide you with a graph (given as an array of nodes and an array of edges), a starting point, and a target point. Please return the shortest path from the starting point to the target point in the following format: 1->2->3->4... Please note that your answer should only include the result in this format and should not contain any other words.(Notice that for the same graph, if the endpoint is changed to the previous point, the new shortest path should be the original shortest path minus the last point.)

The shortest path from node 1 to node 3 in the given graph is:

1->2->3 The path consists of three edges: 1->2, 2->3 and there is no intermediate node between 2 and 3.

If you want to know the shortest path starting from node 1 and ending at any other node, please provide the target node.

The shortest path from node 1 to node 2 in the given graph is:

1->4->2 The path consists of two edges: 1->4 and 4->2.

Note that this is the shortest path starting from node 1 and ending at node 2, and there is no path starting from node 2 to node 3, because node 2 is the only point that has a direct edge to it in the graph. If you want to know the shortest path starting from any other node, please provide the target node.
